page.title: 16Traffic 1. Description
page.content: The main A3 London to Portsmouth Road bisects this Domesday Block. It was widened in the late fifties, to include a major roundabout with underpass at Tibbet's Corner in the north-east and a busy junction at Robin Hood Roundabout in the south-west, a notorious bottleneck in the mornings. The traffic into London is heading for Hammersmith, Putney or Wandsworth Bridges across the River Thames. The traffic is much lighter at weekends into London but heavier on a fine weekend going down to the coast. The heavy weekday traffic moving through this Domesday Block most of the day creates a special nuisance, is noisy, polluting and restrictive to local people. ( For the results of our traffic survey see overleaf)
